decks.notes: The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up powerful plays with cards like Gifts Ungiven and Underworld Breach. By utilizing efficient counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Drain, along with card draw and selection tools like Brainstorm and Merchant Scroll, the deck aims to control the opponent's resources and win the game through powerful combos or locking down the board with cards like Lórien Revealed and Stock Up. Additionally, the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional resilience and value over the course of the game.

The focus of this Merfolk deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Thieving Skydiver, Floodpits Drowner, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Vodalian Hexcatcher and Sink into Stupor helps control the opponent's resources while cards like Hullbreacher and Void Mirror further disrupt their strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and disrupt their game plan to secure a quick victory.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on utilizing a mix of efficient counterspells, removal, and card draw to maintain control over the game. The deck includes a balance of powerful vintage staples like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall, alongside newer additions like Force of Negation and Fatal Push. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. With a strong disruption package and access to powerful threats, this deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and grind out victories through attrition.

This deck focuses on leveraging powerful artifacts like Mana Crypt, Black Lotus, and Moxen to generate mana quickly and efficiently. It also includes cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to draw cards and manipulate artifacts for maximum value. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation help protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck aims to assemble a game-winning combo by chaining together spells and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in the early game.

This deck revolves around using Coveted Jewel to generate advantage and win the game through combo plays. It combines artifact acceleration like Mishra's Workshop and Mana Crypt with powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to dig through the deck and assemble key pieces like Time Vault and The One Ring. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provides protection and additional utility to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while the diversity of mana sources and artifacts ensures versatility and consistency in executing the combo.

This deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration such as Moxen and Black Lotus to cast threats like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap. By efficiently dealing with threats and drawing into more resources, this Dimir Control deck aims to dominate the game and secure victory through superior card advantage and control of the battlefield.

This deck utilizes a combination of disruption, card advantage, and versatile threats to control the opponent's resources and win the game. It focuses on using efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares alongside counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. Additionally, it features versatile creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Psychic Frog, along with threats like Orcish Bowmasters and Lórien Revealed to pressure the opponent.

This deck focuses on using Gifts Ungiven to search for powerful spells and combo pieces to control the game, utilizing cards like Force of Will and Mana Drain to protect its strategy. It aims to set up a powerful board state and generate card advantage with Ancestral Recall and other draw spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recurring key cards from the graveyard, adding resilience to the deck's game plan. The control elements combined with powerful spells create a versatile and adaptable strategy to outplay opponents in Vintage 1 vs 1 matches.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 control deck focuses on utilizing Oath of Druids to quickly get powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield. The deck aims to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm, while also using disruption like Thoughtseize and Vampiric Tutor to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes Show and Tell and Flash as additional ways to cheat creatures into play. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently control the game and quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while utilizing powerful cards such as Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Dig Through Time to overpower opponents. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by casting low-cost permanents from the graveyard. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base, in addition to versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Orcish Bowmasters for both disruption and aggression. Overall, the deck aims to maintain control of the game and outvalue opponents through efficient spells and strategic plays.

This Esper Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal, while utilizing card advantage and powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The deck includes a variety of disruptive elements, such as Mindbreak Trap and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, to disrupt opponents' strategies. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for the recurring of certain spells or creatures. Overall, the deck aims to out-grind opponents through resource denial and efficient card advantage to secure victory in the long game.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro - Hatebear deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hate cards like Trinisphere, Chalice of the Void, and Thorn of Amethyst while deploying aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Clarion Conqueror to quickly close out the game. The deck utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Black Lotus, Moxen, and Ancient Tomb to power out threats ahead of schedule. In addition, disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine further hinder opponents' game plans, while cards like Karn, the Great Creator provide additional utility and flexibility.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that also disrupt the opponent's game plan, forcing them to play on the backfoot. It utilizes hatebears like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent while putting pressure on them with Anointed Peacekeeper and Clarion Conqueror. The deck also includes cards like Void Mirror to shut down opposing spells and creatures. With a mix of disruption and aggression, the deck aims to control the game and come out on top in one versus one matches.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of artifacts such as Null Rod, Sphere of Resistance, and Mishra's Workshop to disrupt opponents' game plans while quickly building a board presence with aggro creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Stonecoil Serpent. The deck also utilizes cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Mystic Forge for additional value and card advantage. With a focus on resource denial and efficient threats, this Aggro - MUD deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hate cards like Anointed Peacekeeper and Archon of Emeria while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. The inclusion of Seasoned Dungeoneer and Witch Enchanter provides card advantage and utility. The mana base is streamlined with powerful fast mana artifacts and land destruction spells to ensure a fast start. The deck aims to control the game through disruption and beat down opponents with efficient creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt opponents with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Sphere of Resistance while accelerating its own game plan with Mishra's Workshop and fast mana rocks. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive artifact creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Nettlecyst, while also utilizing powerful sideboard cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Crucible of Worlds to outvalue opponents and maintain board control. Additionally, the deck incorporates land disruption with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt opponents' mana bases.
